review: I bought this because of the relatively low price point and fun easy functionality.  I did a little research and it pretty much just works as described, no problems.  However, I have mostly apple products and soon after I got Chromecast I got the Apple TV (I was hoping they'd upgrade the hardware in 2013 and Chromecast was the right price to sooth me until the last Apple event that year).  I've barely used Chromecast since I got the Apple TV.  When you have Apple products, it's hard to beat the AirPlay integration of the Apple TV, iCloud, and other such functions.Still, not putting Chromecast down, just giving perspective that you'll probably not need it if you have a Macbook/iPhone/etc and an Apple TV.
author: David tech guy

review: I really like this little guy for streaming video in HD.  It can be moved from TV to TV which is a positive and gives it an advantage over a Roku  However, not many platforms support the streaming yet from applications on the phone but if you can stream from google chrome its great.  Its also great if you want to enlarge your computer internet screen to the television.  No need for the expensive Apple TV.

review: I bought this device because we pay quite a bit for our internet (per megabyte used), and I wanted to be able to utilize my smartphone (unlimited data) to stream movies. Unfortunately, when it says that you can use your smartphone what it means is that you can use your smartphone as a remote. You still have to use your internet.I'm disappointed and will be taking it back.

review: Couldn't have been easier to set up, and it's dirt simple to stick in my pocket and take on a business trip or to a buddy's house. With Google recently granting developer access, it's about to get even more awesome! I love being able to throw my Netflix or YouTube right up on the screen, and can even share whatever web page I'm browsing. Great little device for what is essentially pocket change.
